itale.name: Itale Sorde
itale.description: 小说主人公，年轻的理想主义者，为了自由和正义离开家乡
itale.description_cn: 小说主人公，年轻的理想主义者，为了自由和正义离开家乡
itale.evidence: Itale looked at Piera as she stood half turned from him and saw on the slender nape of her neck the little dark hairs, and the three freckles: a pleasant sight. He was twenty years old, and had never been in love, though he had desired many women. His life had been passed in the country, among peasants and servants, and the daughters of the petty nobility; he had known none of the great ladies of the capital. Piera was the first woman he had ever seen who was not a peasant, a servant, or a provincial lady. She was the first woman he had ever seen who was simply a woman.

laura.name: Laura Sorde
laura.description: Itale的妹妹，聪明而独立，热爱阅读
laura.description_cn: Itale的妹妹，聪明而独立，热爱阅读
laura.evidence: His little sister Laura had been put to bed. She was eleven years old, a thin child with long, dark hair and a delicate face. She was reading a book, sitting up in bed with her knees drawn up to make a lectern of them. She looked up when he came in, and smiled. "Itale," she said, "I have been reading about the Revolution."

guide.name: Guide Sorde
guide.description: Itale的父亲，庄园主，保守而固执，但深爱家人
guide.description_cn: Itale的父亲，庄园主，保守而固执，但深爱家人
guide.evidence: Guide Sorde, the inheritor, was a tall man, spare, dark, with acute grey eyes, a face all bone and sinew, a voice that could be soft or harsh. He had inherited the estate of Malafrena when he was twenty-two, and had managed it for thirty years with a hard hand and a just one. He was respected by his peasants, feared by his servants, and loved by his family with a love that was mixed with fear.

eleonora.name: Eleonora Sorde
eleonora.description: Itale的母亲，温柔而坚强，来自南部平原
eleonora.description_cn: Itale的母亲，温柔而坚强，来自南部平原
eleonora.evidence: His wife Eleonora, a Florentine, was the only thing he had found outside the mountains that he prized. She was small and dark, with a low, sweet voice and a gentle manner, but she had a will of her own. She had taught her children herself until they were old enough to go to the school in the village, and she had taught them well.

emanuel.name: Emanuel Sorde
emanuel.description: Itale的叔叔，律师，比Guide更开明和理性
emanuel.description_cn: Itale的叔叔，律师，比Guide更开明和理性
emanuel.evidence: Guide's brother, though six years younger than he, was greyer. He was a lawyer in the capital, and had been coming home less and less often in the past years. He was a tall man, like his brother, but heavier, with a broad, fair face and a ready laugh. He had married a woman from the city, Perneta, and they had had one child, stillborn. Since then Perneta had been ill more often than not.

perneta.name: Perneta Sorde
perneta.description: Emanuel的妻子，体弱多病但善良
perneta.description_cn: Emanuel的妻子，体弱多病但善良
perneta.evidence: Emanuel and Perneta had had one child, stillborn. Since then Perneta had been ill more often than not. She was a gentle, silent woman, with a sweet face and a look of perpetual weariness.

piera.name: Piera Valtorskar
piera.description: Itale的青梅竹马，美丽而神秘，与Itale有着复杂的感情纠葛
piera.description_cn: Itale的青梅竹马，美丽而神秘，与Itale有着复杂的感情纠葛
piera.evidence: Piera's mother had died when she was two years old, and Eleonora had taken charge of the child at once, firmly, as if by right. Piera had grown up in the Sorde household, a dark, quiet child, always a little apart from the others. She was beautiful, with a pale olive complexion, black hair, and eyes that seemed to look through things rather than at them.

casu.name: Casu Valtorskar
casu.evidence: Old Casu Valtorskar had been a widower for many years. He was a stern old man, very stiff and formal, with a great sense of family pride.

bron.name: Bron
bron.evidence: Bron had been with the family for forty years. He was a faithful servant, devoted to the Sordes, especially to Eleonora, whom he had known since she was a bride.

marta.name: Marta
marta.evidence: Marta was a stout, good-natured woman who had been with the family for many years. She was devoted to Eleonora and the children, and ran the household with a firm but kind hand.

givan_frenin.name: Givan Frenin
givan_frenin.description: Itale的朋友，政治激进分子，革命团体的核心成员
givan_frenin.description_cn: Itale的朋友，政治激进分子，革命团体的核心成员
givan_frenin.evidence: Givan Frenin was a thin, dark young man with bright, fierce eyes. He was the son of a merchant in the old city, and had been educated at the university, where he had become involved in radical politics. He was passionate, eloquent, and utterly committed to the cause of freedom.

tomas_brelavay.name: Tomas Brelavay
tomas_brelavay.description: Itale的朋友，革命团体成员，后来成为警察
tomas_brelavay.description_cn: Itale的朋友，革命团体成员，后来成为警察
tomas_brelavay.evidence: Tomas Brelavay was a big, fair young man, slow-spoken and good-natured. He had been Itale's friend since they were boys together in the capital. He was not a radical by nature, but he had followed Itale into the movement out of loyalty and friendship.

stefan_fabbre.name: Stefan Fabbre
stefan_fabbre.evidence: Stefan Fabbre was a man of about thirty, tall and well-built, with a commanding presence. He had been a lawyer in the capital, and had become famous for his defense of political prisoners. He was a brilliant orator, and his speeches had drawn thousands to the cause of freedom.

lukas_frenin.name: Lukas Frenin
lukas_frenin.description: Givan的表弟，印刷工，革命支持者
lukas_frenin.description_cn: Givan的表弟，印刷工，革命支持者
lukas_frenin.evidence: Lukas Frenin, Givan's cousin, was a printer. He was a quiet, hardworking man who had become involved in the radical movement through his cousin. He was not a leader, but he was a faithful follower, and he risked his life many times for the cause.

valentis.name: Valentis
valentis.evidence: Valentis was a former army officer who had joined the revolution. He was a man of action, impatient with words and theories, but he was brave and decisive, and he inspired confidence in his men.

ferruel.name: Ferruel
ferruel.evidence: Ferruel was a young worker from the industrial quarter of the city. He was a fierce, uncompromising radical who believed in direct action and had no patience with moderation or compromise.

karl.name: Karl
karl.evidence: Karl was a student at the university, a quiet, serious young man who supported the revolution with his pen and his voice, though he was not a leader or a fighter.

jan.name: Jan
jan.evidence: Jan was a printer's devil who worked for Lukas. He was a good-natured, willing lad who did his work well and kept his mouth shut, which was essential in those dangerous times.

mikel.name: Mikel
mikel.evidence: Mikel was one of Guide's tenants, a sturdy, slow-spoken man who had worked the same land for twenty years. He was not a clever man, but he was honest and hardworking, and Guide respected him.

josef.name: Josef
josef.evidence: Josef was another of Guide's tenants, an older man who had known Guide since they were boys. He was a good farmer, though not as prosperous as Mikel, and he was always ready with advice for the younger men.

teacher.name: Teacher
teacher.evidence: The teacher was a thin, scholarly man from the city who had come to the village for reasons of health. He was a good teacher, though strict, and he had given both Itale and Laura a solid foundation in Latin and mathematics.

captain.name: Captain
captain.evidence: The Captain was a professional soldier who had joined the revolution out of conviction. He was a disciplined, courageous man who commanded the respect of his men.

governor.name: Governor
governor.description: 奥匈帝国任命的总督，镇压革命
governor.description_cn: 奥匈帝国任命的总督，镇压革命
governor.evidence: The Governor was a heavy, red-faced man in his fifties, a career official of the Austrian Empire. He had been sent to Orsinia to maintain order, and he took his duty seriously. He had no sympathy for the revolutionaries, and he used all the power at his command to crush the uprising.

soldier.name: Soldier
soldier.evidence: The soldiers were Austrian regulars, disciplined and well-armed. They followed their orders without question, and they had no love for the rebellious Orsinian peasants.

innkeeper.name: Innkeeper
innkeeper.evidence: The innkeeper was a fat, jolly man who knew everything that went on in the city. He was a good source of information, and he was always willing to help the revolutionaries, for a price.

merchant.name: Merchant
merchant.evidence: The merchant was a cautious man who had prospered by not taking sides in politics. He sold goods to both the government and the revolutionaries, and he kept his opinions to himself.

judge.name: Judge
judge.evidence: The Judge was an old man who had served the city for many years. He was known for his honesty and his strict adherence to the law, but he was also known for his mercy.

notary.name: Notary
notary.evidence: The Notary was a precise, careful man who handled all the legal documents for the estate. He had known the Sordes for many years, and he was trusted by them all.

doctor.name: Doctor
doctor.evidence: The Doctor was a middle-aged man from the city who had settled in the valley for reasons of health. He was a competent physician, and he was devoted to his patients.

priest.name: Priest
priest.evidence: The Priest was an old man who had served the parish for many years. He was a conservative, orthodox priest who believed in the divine right of kings and the duty of subjects to obey their rulers.
